Subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue in setUp() methode

> On 9/18/06, isowitz <isowitz@...> wrote:
>>   I have a short question. Is it good to make a assertTrue(), assertEquals
>> () etc. in the setUp() or tearDown() methode?

I've felt a need for this only rarely. In one situation, all tests  
needed the precondition that a certain file did not exist. The setUp  
method deleted this file and then verified that it wasn't there.

I found the assertion was valuable because sometimes files weren't  
able to be deleted. (Maybe my problem would have been better solved by  
eliminating the dependency on the file system.)

To echo other posters, normally I wouldn't put assertions in setup,  
but they can prove valuable in terms of documenting preconditions.

Jeff
